executive_summary: The expansion of online media and marketing has provided fierce competition to digital printers during the current period. Businesses have shifted more of their operations online as technology has improved digital data management. The proliferation of online media has urged companies to market themselves digitally, reducing their need for printed materials. On top of these trends, revenue plunged in 2020 as COVID-19 reduced corporate profit and encouraged more businesses to move operations online. The pandemic recovery caused corporate profit, business formation and paper prices to mount, resulting in a jump in revenue in 2022. Higher interest rates over the past couple of years have heightened recessionary fears, causing companies to tighten their belts and reduce their investment in the industry's services. Despite these challenges, providers' adoption of eco-friendly

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digitization Has Induced a Long-Term Decline in Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Products and personalized and short-run printing have enabled printers to maintain revenue streams, lessening recent declines in revenue. Overall, revenue for digital printing companies in the United States is anticipated to slump at a CAGR of 2.7% during the current period, reaching $15.3 billion in 2024. This includes a 1.7% increase in revenue in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: RECENT ECONOMIC DISRUPTIONS HAVE ENHANCED REVENUE VOLATILITY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When mass vaccination enabled the economy to reopen immediately following the pandemic, consumers returned to shops, restaurants and other stores. This spurred corporate profit, giving businesses more funds for digital printing services. Supply chain disruptions caused the price of paper to soar, enabling providers to pass on high costs to their buyers and giving the industry another valuable revenue stream. Combined, these factors caused revenue to jump in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THERE'S BEEN A SHIFT TOWARD ENVIRONMENTALLY-FRIENDLY PRACTICES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Environmental concerns are a significant trend affecting the Digital Printing industry. Companies have been feeling the pressure to adopt sustainable practices since consumers and corporations have become more eco-conscious. Digital printing inherently produces less waste compared to traditional methods, making it a more appealing option in an environmentally conscious market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Personalized and Short-Run Printing Has Become More Popular
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Advances in digital printing technology have made personalized and short-run printing more cost-effective, boosting the prominence of these methods. Customization is becoming a significant driver of growth, with customers seeking unique and tailored products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Will Benefit From Stable Economic Conditions
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite recent challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, the US economy is expected to expand during the outlook period. Stable economic growth will spur consumer spending and corporate profit, raising demand for digital printing from households and businesses and boosting the industry's performance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Paper prices will continue to rise
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Paper prices will continue to rise as they're expected to increase with inflation. This trend will provide an important revenue stream for the industry over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Digitalization will continue to threaten print
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers will continue shifting toward online content consumption during the outlook period, leaving catalogs, magazines and books on the shelves. On top of this trend, businesses will devote a greater proportion of their advertising budgets to digital marketing as consumers spend more time online. These developments will hinder demand for digital printing services from households, media companies and retailers, constraining revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Environmental consciousness will eventually curb demand for printed materials
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the adoption of eco-friendly products in response to increased environmental consciousness has given digital printers access to valuable revenue streams during the current period, environmental concerns will eventually hinder investment in the industry's services since spending on paperless information will rise as businesses and consumers grow warier about their ecological footprint.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Investment from retailers and wholesalers is expected to remain relatively strong
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While retail and wholesale businesses will shift their advertising expenditure online, they'll continue to use digital printing services for textiles. Since these businesses are a large market for digital printers, relatively positive demand from them will prevent a massive decline in revenue for providers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Printers will integrate artificial intelligence (AI) and automate processes
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As increased productivity during the outlook period spurs technological advancements, AI-driven software will help streamline the entire digital printing process, from design to final product. More printers will be able to self-monitor, predict maintenance needs and optimize settings for each job. AI tools will enable more complex and creative designs by simplifying the workflow. Designers will increasingly focus more on creativity and less on the technical aspects of the print process.

industry_definition: This industry prints graphical materials using digital printing equipment. Digital printers typically provide sophisticated prepress services, using scanners to input images and computers to manipulate and format the graphic images prior to printing. The fundamental difference between digital and traditional printing is that digital printing places images directly onto the substrate (e.g., paper) without the need for plates.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Printers lower prices to stave off internal competition. There are few other ways for providers to differentiate themselves, so players use pricing as a competitive factor.
Digital printers don't face stringent regulations, easing entry and operations in the market. Despite this, navigating copyright laws can be challenging for newcomers, adding a layer of complexity.

Buyers wield significant power in the industry because of the rise of substitutes such as in-house printing and online advertising. With numerous alternatives, businesses and consumers can negotiate prices, enhancing their leverage over digital printers.

Digitalization has become more of a threat to digital print than an opportunity. Digital printing was once a cost-effective alternative to traditional printing methods, but online marketing, media and data management have reduced the need for printed materials.

Advances in digital printing technology have made customized and small-batch printing more affordable. This has attracted businesses seeking unique, tailored products and helped the industry adapt to changing market demands.
Stable economic conditions will benefit digital printers by boosting consumer spending and corporate profit.
GDP growth will also spur increased business formation, giving the industry a more extensive customer base and enhancing revenue growth.
No digital printer generates more than 5.0% of industry revenue. Most printers cater to small- and medium-sized businesses on a local level, so market share concentration is low.

Digital printers need to be wary of copyright issues. Even though they don't produce the material, they can still be held responsible for printing copyrighted content without proper authorization, making it crucial for printers to thoroughly vet any questionable material and include a release clause in contracts.
The industry is subject to regulations from a slew of different agencies. These include the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).

Profit struggles to expand as printers fight to differentiate themselves. Price is one of the few factors that can set digital printers apart, forcing many companies to take less income for themselves.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retailers and wholesalers purchase advertising materials from digital printers, such as product catalogs. Since these businesses use physical advertising often, this market comprises more than one-quarter of revenue.

The industry derives a decent chunk of revenue from publishing businesses (e.g. magazines, newspapers) and entertainment companies (e.g. film and TV producers). Media companies use the industry's services to print promotional materials.
Consumers use digital print services for print jobs that are too large-scale to do themselves.
Nonprofit organizations often outsource printing services to minimize overhead costs.

products_and_services.product_description: A Decline in Print Media Has Reduced Spending on Digitally Printed Magazines and Periodicals
Demand from Labels and Wrappers Benefits from E-Commerce
Some Customers Seek Digitally Printed Catalogs and Directories
INVESTMENT IN FINANCIAL AND LEGAL DOCUMENTS DWINDLES AS COMPANIES START MANAGING DATA DIGITALLY
DIGITALLY PRINTED ADVERTISING IS ONE OF THE INDUSTRY'S MAJOR PRODUCTS
Digital printing companies deal with financial and legal documents, such as financial reports, deposit forms and invoices.
The visual shows a pie chart with two segments. The larger segment, comprising 72% of the pie, is unlabeled.
Digitally-printed magazines and periodicals make up nearly one-tenth of revenue.
Providers also make digitally-printed labels and wrappers.
The industry also makes digitally-printed catalogs and directories.
Digitally Printed Books Remain in High Demand

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of businesses reflects the total number of companies in the United States with at least one employee.
Digitally-printed pamphlets' revenue share has declined substantially during the current period.

business_locations.location_description: THE SOUTHEAST'S POPULATION HUBS ATTRACT DIGITAL PRINTERS
MEDIA COMPANIES OUT WEST USE DIGITAL PRINTING SERVICES
DEMAND FROM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS IS HIGH IN THE MID-ATLANTIC
THE GREAT LAKES REGION IS THE NATION'S MANUFACTURING HUB

regulations_points.regulation_description: Although digital printers don't create the material they print, they can be subject to copyright infringements of printed material.
OSHA is a federal agency that enforces safety and health legislation in the United States.
The EPA sets standards to control emissions and waste from digital printing processes.
CPSIA affects digital printers producing children's products.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Digital printers don't need to comply with significant regulations
barriers_points.barrier_description: Digital printers don't need to comply with significant regulations, and licensing requirements are also relatively light.
However, regulations regarding copyright infringement may be complex for new entrants to navigate.
Acquiring digital printing equipment, hiring skilled labor and paying rent and utilities can be prohibitive for new businesses. Still, start-up costs are ultimately low for small-scale operations.
The industry is highly fragmented, with thousands of small printers offering similar services.

basis_points.basis_title: Printers lower prices to stave off internal competition
basis_points.basis_description: There are few other ways for providers to differentiate themselves, so players use pricing as a competitive factor.
Buyers wield significant power in the industry because of the rise of substitutes such as in-house printing and online advertising.

concentration_points.concentration_title: LOW BARRIERS TO ENTRY ENCOURAGE FRAGMENTATION
concentration_points.concentration_description: It's relatively easy for an individual or group of people to set up a digital printing company since regulation in this industry is low.

concentration_points.concentration_title: ONLINE AND WEB-TO-PRINT TECHNOLOGIES DIMINISH THE NEED FOR DIGITAL PRINTERS
concentration_points.concentration_description: New technologies and the rising popularity of online marketing have reduced the pool of clients for digital printers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: DIGITAL PRINTERS CATER TO SMALL BUSINESSES
concentration_points.concentration_description: Since many digital printing jobs are time sensitive and require a quick turnaround, digital printers settle near clientele.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES AND OTHER COSTS MAINTAIN A STEADY DOMINANCE OVER PRINTERS' EXPENSES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Digital printers purchase inks, toners, containers, paper and other materials that can be printed on.
Other costs include software, maintenance and repairs and waste disposal.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital poses a much higher barrier to entry than labor since the industry requires significant investments in high-quality equipment and materials.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Businesses exchange print advertising for digital
volatility_points.volatility_description: While digital printers initially flourished alongside the surge in computer usage, a significant rise in online advertising expenditure has mitigated demand for print advertising.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in raw material prices influence revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: The costs of paper, ink and other raw materials can swing drastically because of supply chain issues.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: AUGMENTED REALITY PRINTING BRINGS PRINT MATERIAL TO LIFE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Augmented reality technology offers new levels of engagement and interactivity to printed materials.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Trade is low in printing industries, and as a particularly service-oriented form, this industry is largely immune to foreign competition.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: The ease of digital printing setups enable industry companies to more easily offer a wide range of products.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of paper, the main industry input, has increased over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Has your company located in proximity to its key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: Locating in an area with a high concentration of small businesses can help digital printers ensure demand for their services.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Digital printing is by its nature highly automated, and employees are required for important customer service and quality control functions.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Access to the most efficient equipment is vitally important in digital printing due to the low margins in the business.

FAQs.question: How has your company responded to digital needs as digitization continues to accelerate?
FAQs.answer: Digitization has become increasingly important for this industry as the percentage of business conducted online surged.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to adjust to changing environmental standards?
FAQs.answer: The industry is not a substantial polluter, but may benefit from marketing environmentally sustainable print products.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Due in part to heavy price competition, the industry operates with lower profit than more traditional, alternative printing services.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Especially as the print market continues to weaken, companies able to retain long-term customers will be best positioned for success.

FAQs.question: What steps does your company take to ensure your products are attractive to consumers?
FAQs.answer: Product presentation, such as effective use of design and color, is important.

FAQs.question: How do you retain and attract customers? Do you emphasize quality over quantity?
FAQs.answer: Successful companies must be able to produce high quality reports, presentations and printed products.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure that your products are delivered in a timely manner?
FAQs.answer: Successful companies in this industry need to provide prompt delivery through reliable and efficient transfers of digital data and printed goods.

FAQs.question: What is the significance of print advertising expenditure to your company?
FAQs.answer: Print advertising expenditure represents expenditure on advertising in magazines and newspapers for a given year.

FAQs.question: How does the proliferation of the internet impact your business?
FAQs.answer: As the number of households with at least one computer rises, more households are expected to use digital printing firms for large document orders.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the number of businesses in the United States?
FAQs.answer: Small- to medium-sized businesses make up the largest market for industry services.
